page.title: 02HOUSING BRAISHFIELD
page.content:
Braishfield could best be described as a dormitory village, with a population of approximately 600, almost one third of whom are of pensionable age. The residential properties are a mixture of council housing, including 9 O.A.P. bungalows, old cottages, many of which have been restored to modern standards and large modern detached houses owned mostly by executives. The main improvement of recent times is the completion in 1985 of a main sewerage scheme for the whole village.
Isolated cottages in the remainder of the area have proved popular investments for conversion into up to date dwellings-thus commanding high purchase prices when this type of property comes on to the market.
